intro: Orophea pamattonis, commonly known as the red-veined orchid, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
